metadata.title: AKS Exec into Pod
metadata.description: Detects kubectl exec commands into pods which may indicate post-compromise activity.

properties.description: Detects when kubectl exec is used to execute commands in a running container. This can indicate post-compromise lateral movement.
properties.query:
AzureDiagnostics
| where Category == "kube-audit"
| where TimeGenerated > ago(5m)
| extend log = parse_json(log_s)
| extend verb = tostring(log.verb)
| extend objectRef = log.objectRef
| extend user = log.user
| extend sourceIPs = log.sourceIPs
| extend responseStatus = log.responseStatus
| where objectRef.resource == "pods" and objectRef.subresource == "exec"
| where verb == "create"
| extend
    PodName = tostring(objectRef.name),
    Namespace = tostring(objectRef.namespace),
    Username = tostring(user.username),
    UserGroups = tostring(user.groups),
    SourceIP = tostring(sourceIPs[0]),
    StatusCode = tostring(responseStatus.code),
    ClusterName = Resource
| where not(Username startswith "system:")
| where Namespace !in ("kube-system", "gatekeeper-system", "azure-arc")
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    ClusterName,
    Namespace,
    PodName,
    Username,
    SourceIP,
    StatusCode
| summarize
    FirstSeen = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastSeen = max(TimeGenerated),
    ExecCount = count(),
    PodsTargeted = make_set(PodName, 20),
    Namespaces = make_set(Namespace, 10)
    by ClusterName, Username, SourceIP

alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: User '{{Username}}' executed {{ExecCount}} exec commands into pods from IP {{SourceIP}}.
